00062 //  \ \ /\ / / _` \ \ / / _ \ |_ / _ \| '__| '_ ` _ \    | | | | '_ ` _ \| | '_ \ / _` |
00063 //   \ V  V / (_| |\ V /  __/  _| (_) | |  | | | | | |   | | | | | | | | | | | | | (_| |

00067     
00068     // NOTE: If this is a HARDWARE CVD processor, these options do not apply. See the bottom of this
00069     //       file for all related options.
00070     
00071     #define CVD_SETTLING_DELAY          5       // <-- Adjusts the number of additional instruction cycles
00072                                                 //     to add to the Chold&Csensor settling time.
00073                                                 //     The larger this value is, the more susceptible to
00074                                                 //     noise the application will be. However, there is a
00075                                                 //     minimum amount of time required to get full 
00076                                                 //     sensitivity. 
00077                                                 //     For information on how to tune this parameter,
00078                                                 //     please refer to the mTouch Framework documentation.
00079 
00080     #define CVD_CHOLD_CHARGE_DELAY      5       // <-- Adjusts the number of additional instruction cycles
00081                                                 //     to add to the Chold-charge stage of the CVD scan.
00082                                                 //     For information on how to tune this parameter,
00083                                                 //     please refer to the mTouch Framework documentation.
00084 
00085     #define CVD_SWITCH_DELAY            0       // <-- Ideal value for noise immunity is 0.
00086                                                 //     Determines how many NOPs will be added between
00087                                                 //     when the sensor is set to an input and the ADC
00088                                                 //     mux is pointed to the sensor. This value should 
00089                                                 //     ONLY be increased if the output driver is not 
00090                                                 //     disabling itself quickly enough. This will be 
00091                                                 //     noticeable on the second-sample of the waveform: 
00092                                                 //     the settling point will be slightly unstable and 
00093                                                 //     will be visibly coupling to VDD.
00094                                                 //     The behavior is most-noticeable on the second scan
00095                                                 //     due to P-type transistors being less ideal than
00096                                                 //     N-type transistors.
00097                                                 //     The behavior is most-common when Fosc is a high
00098                                                 //     value (16MHz or greater).
00099                                                 //     If you are seeing the behavior, the correct value 
00100                                                 //     for this option will vary based on Fosc and the  
00101                                                 //     microcontroller in question; but, in general,  
00102                                                 //     1-3 NOPs for 16MHz, 3-5 for 32MHz.
00103                                                 
00104                                                 
00105     //#define CVD_FORCE_REF_DAC                 // <-- If defined, the framework will use the DAC as the
00106                                                 //     reference source option.
00107 
00108     
00109     //#define CVD_JITTER_2ND_SAMPLE             // <-- If defined, the second CVD sample of the differential
00110                                                 //     CVD waveform will be randomly delayed. This can help
00111                                                 //     to reduce radiated emissions and may increase noise
00112                                                 //     immunity.
00113                                                 //     NOTE: Do not define if normal jittering is not implemented.
00114                                                 
00115         #define CVD_JITTER_2ND_MASK     0x3F    // <-- Determines the mask used on the 8-bit random variable
00116                                                 //     when loading the decrementing delay counter. The
00117                                                 //     more bits are kept, the larger the randomness.
00118 
00119     
00120

00130     // NOTE: If this is a HARDWARE CVD processor, these options do not apply. See the bottom of this
00131     //       file for all related options.
00132     
00133     //#define CVD_GUARD_IO_ENABLED                                  // <-- If defined, the framework will implement a 
00134                                                                     //     guard sensor using an IO port.
00135                                                                     //     For information about guard sensors, please refer 
00136                                                                     //     to the mTouch Framework documentation.
00137                                                                 
00138         #define CVD_GUARD_PORT              LATA                    // <-- The guard IO's LAT register, prefixed with an underscore.
00139         #define CVD_GUARD_PIN               2                       // <-- The guard IO's pin number
00140 
00141         
00142         
00143     //#define CVD_GUARD_DACOUT_ENABLED                              // <-- If defined, the framework will implement a
00144                                                                     //     guard sensor using the DAC's DACOUT pin.
00145                                                                     //     If available, this can produce better results 
00146                                                                     //     than the regular IO guard.
00147                                                                     
00148         #define CVD_GUARD_DACCON0_A     PIC_DACOUT_DACCON0_HALF_VDD // <-- This is the value that will be loaded into the DACCON0
00149                                                                     //     register prior to ScanA of the differential CVD scan.                                                                    
00150         #define CVD_GUARD_DACCON1_A     PIC_DACOUT_DACCON1_HALF_VDD // <-- This is the value that will be loaded into the DACCON1
00151                                                                     //     register prior to ScanA of the differential CVD scan.   
00152         #define CVD_GUARD_DACCON0_B     PIC_DACOUT_DACCON0_HALF_VDD // <-- This is the value that will be loaded into the DACCON0  
00153                                                                     //     register prior to ScanB of the differential CVD scan.                  
00154         #define CVD_GUARD_DACCON1_B     PIC_DACOUT_DACCON1_HALF_VDD // <-- This is the value that will be loaded into the DACCON1  
00155                                                                     //     register prior to ScanB of the differential CVD scan.  
00156                                                                     //     Valid Values:
00157                                                                     //          - Custom hex value for DACCON register (ex: 0xA0)
00158                                                                     //          - One of the following predefined values:
00159                                                                     //              - PIC_DACOUT_DACCON0_VSS        /   PIC_DACOUT_DACCON1_VSS
00160                                                                     //              - PIC_DACOUT_DACCON0_1_3RD_VDD  /   PIC_DACOUT_DACCON1_1_3RD_VDD
00161                                                                     //              - PIC_DACOUT_DACCON0_HALF_VDD   /   PIC_DACOUT_DACCON1_HALF_VDD
00162                                                                     //              - PIC_DACOUT_DACCON0_2_3RD_VDD  /   PIC_DACOUT_DACCON1_2_3RD_VDD
00163                                                                     //              - PIC_DACOUT_DACCON0_VDD        /   PIC_DACOUT_DACCON1_VDD
00164     
00165

00180     //#define CVD_MUTUAL_ENABLED                      // <-- If defined, the framework will integrate a mutual
00181                                                     //     sensor into the differential CVD scan.
00182     //#define CVD_MUTUAL_EXCLUSIVE_ENABLED          // <-- If defined, the framework will perform an
00183                                                     //     exclusively-mutual scan. There will be no charge
00184                                                     //     averaging between the external and internal caps.
00185
